title: Why do you like BTS? - Quora

response.answer_text: ‘ＷＨＹ ＤＯ ＹＯＵ ＬＩＫＥ ＢＴＳ？’  Okay what kinda question even is this ain’t it obvious 😂 But I’ll gladly tell you. But I first wanna say that most people think we love BTS because of their visuals… I mean, it’s not wrong… They’re handsome and cute, but most of the time that’s not the reason, and if you’re an “ARMY” just because of their visuals, please leave. That’s not a valid reason to love them. That’s super diva. I’m actually not really a K-pop stan. Sure, I sometime listen to other bands other than BTS, like ‘LOVE SCENARIO’ by iKon or ‘WHISTLE’ by BLACKPINK, but I’m not really a fan of those groups, I’m only an ARMY so I will gladly tell you why I am an ARMY. In the beginning I didn’t even know that such a thing called ‘K-pop’ existed. Of course, I knew that other countries had music too, but I just never realized it. I was really a big fan of Taylor Swift, Selena Gomez and Billie Eilish, and I still like them but I haven’t heard American pop in five months 😂 1. Dancing K-pop artists dance WAY more. When it’s a male American artists, they mostly just sit on a couch or a bed and they just look in the camera. BTS on the other hand (and other K-pop groups, of course) dance instead of just boringly sitting on a couch. One negative thing is that they have to lip sync pretty much, since the choreography is hard and exhausting, but they CAN sing beautiful even without autotune and sometimes they don’t lip sync.  Now haters be thinking: “So What”? (lame joke lol) “They still can’t sing especially Jin.” …  And Seok-jin CAN sing alright. Who cares if he’s the weakest vocalist of The Vocal Line, HIS VOICE IS STILL AN ANGEL’S. And have you seen the DNA-dance? THEN you’ll understand why they lip sync, you’ll literally die from exhaustion because it’s just too exhausting and frustration because you cannot perfect the dance.  2. Songs I like the fact that it’s a mixture between Korean and English, not always the same language. Of course I don’t understand everything since I don’t speak Korean and when they’re speaking English their pronunciation ain’t that good. And then, the famous words of non k-pop friends/parents: “Why do you listen to them when you don’t even understand them?”  Never heard of lyric videos, lyric translation, subtitles and other shit? And when you finally understand what they’re singing, you cry because the lyric is so beautiful (they make their music/lyrics themselves most of the time). “We were always hoarse from an uncertain future and worries,Seeing all the senior artists at the end of the year awards.Let’s not forget those things, but put them away.” — “Moving On” “I believe in myself;My back hurts in order to let my wings sprout.” — “Wings” “Who says a dream must be something grand?Just become anybodyWe deserve a lifeWhatever, big or small, you are you after all.” — “Paradise” “Follow your dream like breaker.Even if it breaks down,Don’t ever run backwards, never.Because the dawn right before the sun rises is the darkest.” — “Tomorrow” I also like that there’s always a rap verse in the songs, and those lyrics are not about drugs or sex, but also about beautiful things. It’s also always another voice and not always the same person. Though I would want Jin to sing more, my favorite solo’s from BTS are from Jin (‘Epiphany’ and ‘Awake’) Jungkook is the lead vocalist and his voice is beautiful, so is Jimin’s and Tae’s, but Jin’s is too. I know he’s a supporter, but he also has a beautiful voice and sometimes he has to BEG for more lines.  Love Yourself: Her Love Yourself: Tear Love Yourself: Answer (my favorite)So one of the main reasons is because the message they give is unlike other artists. Other artists mostly talk about break-ups and love, but BTS mostly sings about self love. They think that real love begins with self love and that is true, I really appreciate the beautiful message they’re giving. They did the project ‘Love Yourself’ (Love Yourself: Her — Love Yourself: Tear — Love Yourself: Answer) and thanks to them, some ARMY’s were finally able to love themselves. 3. Personality Male American artists are mostly fuckboys/players or just really selfish. There are very few male American artists I think are kind. Right now I can only think of Shawn Mendes. But all the BTS members are really kind. They aren’t players and if you’re thinking ‘Yes, but that’s probably because Big Hit Entertainment bans them from doing that since they’ll ruin their reputation by that’, you’re right. Big Hit Entertainment wouldn’t allow that because their reputation would be ruined. And it’s not like I know them personally, I’ve only seen them on Vlives, Run BTS!, Eat Jin, BTS Bon Voyage, Bangtang Bomb, interviews and etc. But they really seem like kind boys and I don’t think they’re acting (I’m sorry, but I’ve seen them acting and even though Jungkook is the Golden Maknae who’s good at everything, his acting isn’t that good). They also get along well with each other. For example: I don’t really think BLACKPINK can get along that well with each other (sorry if I’m wrong, it’s just my opinion). When Lisa and Jisoo are being their normal crackheads, Jennie and Rosé just stare at them like wtf and sometimes you can the the atmosphere is pretty awkward and they don’t even talk to each other. But BTS, oh man, put two members with each other doesn’t matter who and they’re SO caring and funny. And because of their love for each other the ARMY’s have created ships. My favorite is Jinkook, Taekook and Namjin. But of course my FAVORITE FAVORITE FAVORITE ship is OT7.  I also wanted to mention the parents of BTS, Jin and Namjoon. Jin is the eldest member of BTS and Namjoon is the leader, so of course that makes them a good parenting duo, so I really like the ‘Namjin’ ship. The other members even said that Jin and Namjoon are the ones holding BTS together.   This is the main reason why I like them: they’re funny crackheads who never fail to make me laugh, they just put the biggest smile on your face. I’m only a few seconds into a ‘Try Not To Laugh W/ BTS’ and I already fail, they’re just too funny. Individually they’re already hopeless crackheads but when you PUT THEM TOGETHER… it’s a total chaos. BTS aren’t clowns, they’re the whole circus. TXT: ‘We want to be like our seniors, BTS’. This family is going to be funny but way too unstable 😂 And you would think they only act like this in private or on Run BTS! or whatever ones of their shows, but YOU’RE WRONG. They also act like crackheads in PUBLIC and on AWARD SHOWS.  When they won a prize for their song ‘I Need U’ they put lipstick on each other’s faces bwahahha I can’t with these guys  When all the idols showed up on the award show in fancy, expensive black suits and the girls in expensive black dresses but BTS showed up in Pokémon outfits 😂 Not only that, BTS is basically a whole meme.      Sailor Moon? More like Sailor JOON HAHHAHA (so lame I know 😂)  This photo of Namjoon is too hilarious I can’t—  Lol, get it? BLACKPINK 😂    I love it when Jin screams ;-; 😂       How ARMY’s fight   Yes these two are the same persons ☝👇   A short compilation of Jungkook being Jungshook  One thing I also really like is that they’re not show offs/diva’s. I mean, they’re the most famous and successful boyband in the world, yet they’re still kind, don’t spend their money on idiot things like the Kardashians and don’t act all stuck-up and arrogant. 4. Content It ain’t normal how many content these guys have. They always post so that they can interact better with ARMY and their content is really entertaining and funny. They never fail to entertain us and they don’t keep us waiting. Because of their content we also know more of them than we know American artists.  Run BTS!  V Lives (I know Run BTS! and their other shows are published on V Live but I mean their livestreams)  BTS Bon Voyage  BANGTANTV/BTS BOMB, they already have over 31 million subscribers (lol omfg last time I checked it was 21 million subs and within a week or two weeks they already got 10+ million subs jeez bitches slow down 😂)  Twitter (you CANNOT scroll more than five minutes on Twitter without seeing BTS)  Eat Jin (V Lives where Jin eats) And they also have an Instagram account and TikTok and maybe more but it’s too much that I don’t know all of ’em (yes, that means FOLLOW THEM ON TIKTOK AND INSTAGRAM). 5. Music Videos Their music videos are so good. Sometimes they’re quite colorful (like Boy with Luv or DNA) or sometimes they’re a little darker (like Fake Love or Blood Sweat & Tears) K-pop videos are famous for their visuals, effects and other stuff. I mean, you wouldn’t see the stuff that appeared in Blood Sweat & Tears in an American music video, would you? American music videos by male artists are mostly strippers selling off their body and being touchy with the artist. No thank you, I prefer BTS’s music videos. Big Hit is also famous for their concepts and theories in their MV’s. Lol I use my brain more for BTS theories than school.   6. They’re an inspiration Come on, EVERYONE has heard about BTS, if it’s about their looks, music or rise in popularity. If not, you lived under a rock (like me, I didn’t knew BTS existed until a few years ago). But they weren’t always this popular. BTS debuted back in 2013, seven years ago, under a company called Big Hit Entertainment. At that time Big Hit was a VERY small company (now Big Hit Entertainment is one of the Big 3 Best K-pop Companies, putting JYP Entertainment on Number 4 UwU) almost nobody heard from them, so it’s normal that people thought BTS wouldn’t be a big group. In the beginning they were already happy with 300 views, 300 attendants to their concerts and fansigns and etc. They all had to sleep together in one apartment and couldn’t even have a company dinner because Big Hit didn’t had the money for it. During the N.O.-era they almost disbanded because they were too low on budget. They debuted with their song ‘No More Dream’ on June 13, 2013, and I gotta say, it’s not the best song. But in the beginning they were a group who was focused on hip hop and I just don’t like hip hop in general. By the way, with “it’s not the best song” I mean it’s not that good because it’s sang in a wrong way. BTS sang it again in 2019 or so and it. Was. BEAUTIFUL. This just proves all songs are good but you gotta sing it in a good way.  They also got mocked a lot in the beginning and had A LOT of haters, and many people said they couldn’t make it. Their songs either fell of the charts pretty fast or didn’t even chart at all. Even though people still told them they couldn’t make it, they didn’t give up and still wanted to pursue their dream of becoming a successful artist. In 2014 they won a real award for ‘I NEED U’ (and they put lipstick on each other’s faces lol) but they still weren’t that popular. But once again, they didn’t stop. They still wanted to pursue their dream and got support from the few ARMY they had that time. After “I NEED U”, “RUN” they became more popular, and when “FIRE” came out they were one of the best idols in South-Korea. However, everything changed during the “Blood, Sweat & Tears”-era and they became internationally famous. After that they broke record after record. “BTS is the first boyband in Korean history to win over FORTY Daesangs” “BTS is the first K-pop band to perform at the AMA’s” “BTS is the first K-pop band to perform at the BBMA’s” “BTS is the first K-pop band to win FOUR BBMA-awards” “BTS is the first K-pop band to have won a BBMA’s ‘Top Social Artist’ award three years in a row with over 280 MILLION votes” “BTS is the first K-pop band to win a BBMA’s ‘Top Duo/Group’ award” “BTS is the first K-pop band to perform at the Grammy’s” “BTS’s ‘Map of the Soul Persona’ is the most sold album of 2019 over the world” “BTS has set a record of getting more than 74 million views in 24 hours” “BTS’s “DNA” has reached over 1 BILLION views on YouTube” “The President of South Korea signed BTS’s watches and admitted they’re one of the Elite 4 of South Korea”  BTS performing Fake Love at the BBMA’s and Jungkook showing off his abs 😌 And MANY other prizes, it’d take me four hours or something to put every prize they won here. Basically what I want to say is that even though BTS had a SUPER low chance of being a successful artist, they did not give up. Even though people mocked them and every year they saw their seniors winning prizes and they did not, they did not give up. Even though they felt hopeless and petite compared to the other groups, they did not give up. Even though some of the members own parents didn’t support them, they did not give up. BTS was a small rookie group coming from a small company and had the lowest chance of survival, but now they’re the biggest boyband in Korean history and on the world, maybe even bigger than the Backstreet Boys or One Direction (no, I’d say BTS is more successful because they won WAY more prizes than the Backstreet Boys and One Direction and have WAY more fans, but I don’t know if they’re bigger than The Beatles). Now they always sell out all their concerts and stadiums, they have billions of fans, have millions of views, own their own luxury and expensive apartments and can dine at the most expensive restaurants. This is why they’re an inspiration, you can never know what will happen in the future. They had a big chance of failure and they could’ve lost everything, but they still didn’t want to give up their dream. I really respect and appreciate them for that.
